message: Hey, I've seen (forget where) that the timeout on the live endpoint is 30 seconds. Obviously this is subject to change and tweakage by the convore team
is it possible for you to expose the current timeout setting in the response given by live? If it's not something that fits neatly within the payload then even an HTTP header is fine
what I'd like to be able to do is treat actual timeouts detected in my own code as reachability events - f/e if I don't get back a response within 45 seconds, maybe I've got connectivity issues
Basically something that I can add something like 15 seconds to so that I can detect timeouts between the client and convore
ericflo, I noticed that as well, thought it was a good call for them to be strings
Just added this, it's an HTTP header: X-Live-Frequency
@ericflo maybe.... just realized that I'm not filtering the live.json to the right place
